options.name: attachmentsUi

values.name: property
values.description: Add the field name from the input node. Multiple properties can be set separated by comma.

options.description: Array of supported attachments to add to the message

options.name: bccList
options.description: The email addresses of the blind copy recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: ccList
options.description: The email addresses of the copy recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: fromAlias
options.description: Select the alias to send the email from. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: replyTo
options.description: The email address that the reply message is sent to

options.name: threadId
options.description: The identifier of the thread to attach the draft

options.name: sendTo
options.description: The email addresses of the recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachment. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is 'attachment_' the first attachment is saved to 'attachment_0'.

options.name: downloadAttachments
options.description: Whether the draft's attachments will be downloaded

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachments. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is 'attachment_' the first attachment is saved to 'attachment_0'.

options.name: downloadAttachments
options.description: Whether the draft's attachments will be downloaded

options.name: includeSpamTrash
options.description: Whether to include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results

options.name: labelListVisibility
options.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface

options.name: messageListVisibility
options.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

options.name: Send and Wait for Response
options.action: Send message and wait for response

properties.name: sendTo
properties.description: The email addresses of the recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: appendAttribution
options.description: Whether to include the phrase “This email was sent automatically with n8n” to the end of the email

options.name: attachmentsUi

values.name: property
values.description: Add the field name from the input node. Multiple properties can be set separated by comma.
values.hint: The name of the field with the attachment in the node input

options.description: Array of supported attachments to add to the message

options.name: bccList
options.description: The email addresses of the blind copy recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: ccList
options.description: The email addresses of the copy recipients. Multiple addresses can be separated by a comma. e.g. jay@getsby.com, jon@smith.com.

options.name: senderName
options.description: The name that will be shown in recipients' inboxes

options.name: replyTo
options.description: The email address that the reply message is sent to

options.name: replyToSenderOnly
options.description: Whether to reply to the sender only or to the entire list of recipients

properties.name: simple
properties.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachment. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is 'attachment_' the first attachment is saved to 'attachment_0'.

options.name: downloadAttachments
options.description: Whether the email's attachments will be downloaded and included in the output

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: simple
properties.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

properties.displayName: Fetching a lot of messages may take a long time. Consider using filters to speed things up
properties.name: filtersNotice

options.name: includeSpamTrash
options.description: Whether to include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results

options.name: labelIds
options.description: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

options.name: q
options.hint: Use the same format as in the Gmail search box. More info.
options.description: Only return messages matching the specified query

options.name: readStatus
options.hint: Filter emails by whether they have been read or not

options.name: receivedAfter
options.description: Get all emails received after the specified date. In an expression you can set date using string in ISO format or a timestamp in miliseconds.

options.name: receivedBefore
options.description: Get all emails received before the specified date. In an expression you can set date using string in ISO format or a timestamp in miliseconds.

options.name: sender
options.description: Sender name or email to filter by
options.hint: Enter an email or part of a sender name

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachment. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is 'attachment_' the first attachment is saved to 'attachment_0'.

options.name: downloadAttachments
options.description: Whether the email's attachments will be downloaded and included in the output

properties.name: labelIds
properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

options.name: Approval
options.description: User can approve/disapprove from within the message

options.name: Free Text
options.description: User can submit a response via a form

options.name: Custom Form
options.description: User can submit a response via a custom form

values.name: fieldLabel
values.description: Label that appears above the input field

values.name: fieldType
values.description: The type of field to add to the form

values.name: elementName
values.description: Optional field. It can be used to include the html in the output.

values.name: placeholder
values.description: Sample text to display inside the field

values.name: fieldName
values.description: The name of the field, used in input attributes and referenced by the workflow

values.name: fieldValue
values.description: Input value can be set here or will be passed as a query parameter via Field Name if no value is set

values.name: fieldOptions
values.description: List of options that can be selected from the dropdown

values.name: multiselect
values.description: Whether to allow the user to select multiple options from the dropdown list

values.name: html
values.description: HTML elements to display on the form page

values.name: multipleFiles
values.description: Whether to allow the user to select multiple files from the file input or just one

values.name: acceptFileTypes
values.description: Comma-separated list of allowed file extensions
values.hint: Leave empty to allow all file types

values.displayName: The displayed date is formatted based on the locale of the user's browser
values.name: formatDate
requiredField
values.description: Whether to require the user to enter a value for this field before submitting the form

options.name: limitWaitTime
options.description: Whether the workflow will automatically resume execution after the specified limit type

values.name: limitType
values.description: Sets the condition for the execution to resume. Can be a specified date or after some time.

options.name: After Time Interval
options.description: Waits for a certain amount of time

options.name: At Specified Time
options.description: Waits until the set date and time to continue

values.name: resumeAmount
values.description: The time to wait

values.name: resumeUnit
values.description: Unit of the interval value

values.name: maxDateAndTime
values.description: Continue execution after the specified date and time

options.name: appendAttribution
options.description: Whether to include the phrase "This message was sent automatically with n8n" to the end of the message

options.name: responseFormTitle
options.description: Title of the form that the user can access to provide their response

options.name: responseFormDescription
options.description: Description of the form that the user can access to provide their response

options.name: limitWaitTime
options.description: Whether the workflow will automatically resume execution after the specified limit type

values.name: limitType
values.description: Sets the condition for the execution to resume. Can be a specified date or after some time.

options.description: Waits for a certain amount of time

options.name: At Specified Time
options.description: Waits until the set date and time to continue

values.description: The time to wait

values.name: resumeUnit
values.description: Unit of the interval value

values.name: maxDateAndTime
values.description: Continue execution after the specified date and time

options.description: Whether to include the phrase "This message was sent automatically with n8n" to the end of the message
